title: MK Stalin To Boycott Governor's Independence Day Reception Over "Anti-Tamil Nadu Acts"
content: This comes against the backdrop of repeated clashes over Bills passed by the Assembly but kept pending at Raj Bhavan.

title: Trump Says 25% Chance Alaska Summit With Putin Could Fail: Top Points
content: Ahead of his meeting with Vladimir Putin in Alaska, US President Donald Trump said he believes his Russian counterpart is ready to make a deal to end the war in Ukraine.

title: PM Modi's Big Announcement: Rs 1 Lakh Crore Scheme For Youth Entering Job Market
content: Delivering his address to the nation on the 79th Independence Day, PM Modi said the "Pradhan Mantri Viksit Bharat Rozgar Yojana" will come into effect immediately.

title: 79th Independence Day: A Look Back At PM Modi's Many Colorful Turbans
content: On the 79th Independence Day, PM Modi sported a saffron turban for his 12th consecutive address to the nation from the ramparts of the Red Fort.

title: "Maha Kumbh's Success Is Testimony To Strength Of India": PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday hailed the success of Maha Kumbh in Prayagraj as a testimony to the strength of India.

title: Everything Matched Body For Body, Gun For Gun: Trump-Putin Alaska Summit
content: When Donald Trump announced the Alaska meeting with Vladimir Putin, the lone agent assigned to the Secret Service's post in the Last Frontier began preparing to host hundreds of reinforcements.

title: "Made-In-India Semiconductor Chip To Come In Market By This Year End": PM
content: First made-in-India semiconductor chip will be launched in the market by the end of this year, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said on Friday.

title: India Won't Differentiate Between Terrorists And Those Supporting Them: PM
content: India will not fall for any blackmail and tolerate nuclear threats anymore, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said, as he hit out at Pakistan and lauded the Indian armed forces for its role in carrying out Operation Sindoor.

title: At 103 Minutes, PM Modi Delivers His Longest Independence Day Speech
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday delivered his longest Independence Day speech to date, as he addressed the nation for a remarkable 103 minutes (1 hour 43 minutes) from the ramparts of the Red Fort.

title: "Every Citizen Must Feel Protected": PM Modi Announces 'Mission Sudarshan Chakra'
content: PM Modi said the 'Mission Sudarshan Chakra' will be research-based and developed entirely with indigenous technology.

title: "India Won't Tolerate Nuclear Blackmail": PM Modi's Big Message To Pakistan
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has delivered a clear message to Pakistan following a nuclear threat from the neighbouring country over India's decision to suspend the Indus Waters Treaty.

title: GST Reform To Rozgar Yojana: PM Modi's Big Independence Day Announcements
content: n his speech, the Prime Minister presented India's roadmap for self-reliance by 2047 and announced several schemes to empower youths, women and business.

title: "Opened Nuclear Sector To Private Firms": PM Modi's Big Energy Reliance Plan
content: India is opening up the private sector for nuclear energy, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said on Friday on the occasion of the 78th Independence Day.

title: Independence Day Live Updates: “Sudarshan Chakra Mission To Develop Made-In-India Weapons”: PM Modi
content: In his longest Independence Day speech in the last 12 years, PM Modi focused on building a Viksit Bharat (developed nation).

title: "Nationwide Security Shield To Cover All Public Places By 2035": PM Modi's Top Quotes
content: PM Modi addressed the nation from the Red Fort on India's 79th Independence Day today. The Prime Minister hoisted the national flag for the 12th consecutive time at the iconic monument in New Delhi.

title: "Economic Selfishness On The Rise": PM Modi Amid Trump Tariff Tensions
content: In a clear message to citizens in the face of the US's tariff and penalty threats, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said India is "unstoppable" and it is time for the country to prove its mettle in the global markets with quality products.

title: PM Says India Will Make Its Own Space Station, Congratulates Shubhanshu Shukla
content: India is working towards becoming self-reliant in the space sector, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said on Friday.

title: PM Modi Promises "Double Diwali" And "Next-Generation" Tax Gift This Year
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has promised a Diwali gift for the citizens of the country in his speech on the occasion of the 79th Independence Day.

title: "Op Sindoor Would Not Have Succeeded If India Was Not Atmanirbhar": PM Modi In Independence Day Speech
content: In his address to the nation on the 79th Independence Day, PM Modi praised the "brave soldiers who punished masters of terror beyond their imagination" during Operation Sindoor.

title: Independence Day 2025: 2 Mi-17 Choppers Carry Op Sindoor Banners Above Red Fort, Shower Petals
content: While the celebration of India's 79th Independence Day is underway, two Mi-17 helicopters of the Indian Air Force flew above the Red Fort, showering petals.

title: The NBA schedule is out! Here are the best games -- and beefs -- to watch this season
content: Following the NBA's schedule release, our insiders break down which 2025-26 games have the most intrigue.

title: Sources: NFLPA puts one of top lawyers on leave
content: The NFL Players Association put Heather McPhee, whose allegations helped prompt a federal investigation, on paid administrative leave after multiple employees filed complaints with the union's human resources department, sources said.

title: Browns' Judkins won't face charge for July arrest
content: Prosecutors have declined to file a formal misdemeanor battery charge against Browns rookie running back Quinshon Judkins, a spokesperson for the Broward State Attorney's Office in Florida told ESPN.

title: Bond won't be charged, says he's joining Browns
content: The sexual assault case against former Texas wide receiver Isaiah Bond has been no-billed and he faces no further criminal charges, Collin County (Texas) District Attorney Greg Willis said.

title: Hot-putting MacIntyre takes BMW lead with 62
content: Robert MacIntyre seized on a softer Caves Valley after a two-hour storm delay and rode the best putting round of his year with six straight birdies to post an 8-under 62 for a three-shot lead over Tommy Fleetwood in the BMW Championship on Thursday.

title: Hello again: Durant, Davis returns mark NBA slate
content: The Rockets' Kevin Durant will make his return to Phoenix on Nov. 24, while the Mavs' Anthony Davis will return to L.A. to play the Lakers on Nov. 28.

title: First-place Phillies to use 6 SPs with Nola return
content: Phillies manager Rob Thomson said Thursday that he will utilize a six-man rotation beginning this weekend when Aaron Nola returns from the injured list.

title: Packers' Love: Surgery now so 100% for Week 1
content: Packers quarterback Jordan Love opted to have surgery on his left thumb this week because he didn't want to go into the season with any nagging injuries.

content: Former Birmingham City manager Wayne Rooney has said Tom Brady's criticism about his work ethic was "unfair."

content: With six weeks left in the 2025 season, a number of winning streaks have led to much tighter division battles, making for some exciting baseball.

content: LeBron will be a free agent next summer. Giannis and Jokic are eligible for massive extensions. But those aren't the only topics we're watching.

content: The star women's basketball pairing dished on when they realized they'd connect, who their favorite WNBA player is and more.

content: Atlanta will be the 2-seed in the playoffs, Seattle will reach the postseason and not one head coach will get fired.

content: From a Lynx-Liberty showdown to the regular-season finale, these are the most impactful WNBA games left.

content: The son of Brad Johnson is entering his sixth year of college after rehabbing a broken leg, still hoping that he can play his way into the NFL draft.

content: The superstar debuted on Jason and Travis Kelce's "New Heights" podcast, talked about becoming a football fan.

content: Despite backlash, MSG Entertainment's "attorney exclusion list" is still in effect, reportedly banning over a thousand lawyers since 2022.

content: Will your team beat its projected win total? What props should you target? Here are three bets we like for every NFL team.

title: NFL betting: Eight player props we like to hit the 'over' this season
content: Optimism is the theme, with the "over" bet being a popular play in Liz Loza and Daniel Dopp's "Props that Pop."

title: NBA 2K26 reveals top 10 3-point and mid-range shooter ratings
content: Stephen Curry and Nikola Jokic top the 3-point and mid-range shooting ratings in NBA 2K26, respectively.

title: 'Daam kam, dum zyada': PM’s strong pitch amid tariff war; big 'Make in India' push on I-Day
content: From the Red Fort, Prime Minister Modi responded to US tariff threats by championing a self-reliant India, urging focus on high-quality, affordable products with the mantra 'Daam kam, dum zyada.' He emphasised 'vocal for local' to achieve a prosperous India, calling on influencers and political parties to promote indigenous products and build a stronger global image through commitment and quality.

title: PM Modi promises big Diwali gift! GST reforms to lower tax burden; what he said in I-Day speech
content: Prime Minister Modi announced upcoming GST reforms as a Diwali gift, promising a reduced tax burden. A group of state ministers will meet to discuss potential GST reductions for various products, with some opposing changes due to revenue concerns.

title: 1983 World Cup, MS Dhoni's treble and more: India's greatest cricket feats since 1947
content: Since 1947, India's cricket journey has been filled with remarkable milestones, including their first Test win in 1952 and series victory against Pakistan. The 1983 World Cup triumph marked a turning point, while MS Dhoni's leadership secured multiple ICC titles. India's dominance in Test cricket at home and recent victories in major tournaments highlight their enduring legacy.

title: 'The time has come': Stalin urges legal battle; TN CM calls to reclaim states’ powers
content: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin, in his Independence Day address, urged citizens to reject bigotry and protect the marginalized. He accused the Centre of usurping states' powers in key sectors like education and creating financial dependencies through biased policies. Stalin emphasized the need for political and legal battles to protect states' rights and financial shares, advocating for true federalism.

title: Jamie Dimon on US-China tech race: Calls reliance on Beijing ‘embarrassing’
content: The Nvidia H20 chip sales to China are under scrutiny. This has intensified the US-China tech rivalry. Jamie Dimon warns about US vulnerability. He points out dependence on China for essential goods. Chinese regulators question Nvidia chip purchases. They are pushing for domestic alternatives. Nvidia denies security risks. China is asking tech firms to reconsider Nvidia orders.

title: I-Day 2025: Tiranga, Operation Sindoor banner soar above Red Fort - video
content: India's 79th Independence Day celebrated the success of Operation Sindoor, targeting terror sites in Pakistan and PoK. PM Modi, addressing the nation from Red Fort, asserted India's firm stance against terrorism, vowing to hold Pakistan accountable for any future aggression. He lauded the armed forces for their unprecedented action during Operation Sindoor, setting a new standard in combating cross-border terrorism and avenging the Pahalgam attack.

title: 85+ Happy Independence Day messages, greetings, wishes & quotes
content: India gears up to celebrate its 79th Independence Day in 2025, commemorating freedom achieved on August 15, 1947. The nation will honour its history through flag-hoisting, parades, and cultural events. Citizens are encouraged to share patriotic wishes, messages, and quotes on social media, reflecting on sacrifices made and reaffirming commitment to unity and progress.

title: 'Cricket bahut chhoti cheez hai desh aur jawaano ke aage': Harbhajan Singh on India vs Pakistan in Asia Cup
content: Following recent terror attacks and heightened tensions, calls for India to boycott Pakistan in cricket are growing. During the World Championship of Legends, India Champions refused to play Pakistan Champions. Harbhajan Singh advocates for the current team to follow suit in the Asia Cup, emphasizing that national interests outweigh sports, especially considering the sacrifices made by soldiers.

title: Fake Labubu dolls flood markets; urgent warning issued — how to know if yours is original
content: The UK's Chartered Trading Standards Institute has issued a warning about the influx of counterfeit Labubu dolls, citing potential choking hazards for children. These fake toys, spurred by the genuine Pop Mart plushie's popularity, lack safety checks and proper construction.

title: I-Day: US extends warm wishes; calls 'historical ties' with India 'far-reaching'
content: The United States congratulated India on its 79th Independence Day, highlighting the significant and extensive historical ties between the two nations. Both countries share a vision for a more peaceful, prosperous, and secure Indo-Pacific region, collaborating across various sectors including technology and space.

title: I-Day: 'RSS biggest NGO in the world' - Top quotes from PM Modi's speech
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi addressed the nation from the Red Fort on the 79th Independence Day, marking his 12th consecutive address. He paid tribute to Mahatma Gandhi and hoisted the flag, emphasising the theme of 'Naya Bharat' and the vision of 'Viksit Bharat' by 2047. Modi saluted the armed forces and highlighted India's stance against nuclear threats, referencing actions taken after the Pahalgam attack.

title: GitHub rules: CEO Thomas Dohmke to employees; ‘I don’t want to use...’
content: GitHub CEO Thomas Dohmke mandated the use of the platform for all employees, emphasizing its integral role in the company culture. Under his leadership, GitHub experienced significant growth, particularly with AI-powered development tools like GitHub Copilot. However, Dohmke has recently resigned to pursue entrepreneurial ventures, leading to GitHub's integration into Microsoft's CoreAI team by the end of 2025.

title: 'He won’t be the same player if he…': Ex India cricketer bold verdict on Virat Kohli
content: S. Sreesanth defended Virat Kohli's aggressive style, terming it as passion essential for his success. He reflected on the 2008 IPL incident with Harbhajan Singh, revealing its impact on his family and his daughter's perception. Sreesanth emphasized that he wouldn't alter his cricket journey, embracing both challenges and controversies as learning experiences.

title: 79th Independence Day: PM Modi continues 'safa' tradition; opts for saffron turban
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to lead the 79th Independence Day celebrations, marking his 12th consecutive address from the Red Fort. Since 2014, PM Modi has showcased India's cultural diversity by wearing distinctive, colourful turbans. Each year, his turban reflects a different region or style, from Rajasthani bandhani to leheriya prints, paired with traditional kurta-churidar and jackets.

title: 79th I-Day: PM Modi breaks Indira Gandhi's record; delivers 12th straight speech from Red Fort
content: Narendra Modi has surpassed Indira Gandhi's record for consecutive Independence Day addresses from the Red Fort, delivering his 12th speech on Friday. Only Jawaharlal Nehru has delivered more consecutive speeches. Modi broke Manmohan Singh's record last year and in 2023, he delivered the longest Independence Day speech at 98 minutes, combining policy announcements with reflections on India’s progress.

title: FASTag annual pass launch: Steps to activate Rs 3,000 pass easily; key benefits, FAQs
content: The National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) will launch the FASTag Annual Pass on August 15, 2025, priced at Rs 3,000 for private vehicles. This pass allows up to 200 trips on designated National Highways and Expressways or is valid for one year. Activation is through the Rajmarg Yatra app or NHAI website, simplifying toll payments for frequent travelers.

title: 46 dead, 100 injured in J&K: Cloudburst wipes out pilgrims' camp in Kishtwar
content: A devastating cloudburst in Kishtwar, J&K, struck a pilgrimage pit stop at Chishoti, resulting in at least 46 fatalities, primarily among Shri Machail Mata Yatra pilgrims. Over 100 individuals sustained injuries, and numerous others remain missing. Rescue operations, involving the Army, police, and NDRF, have saved approximately 160 people.

title: ‘First job, Rs15k from govt’: PM announces Viksit Bharat Rozgar Yojana in I-Day speech
content: Prime Minister Modi introduced the PM Viksit Bharat Rozgar Yojana on Independence Day, effective from August 1, 2025. This initiative aims to generate 3.5 crore jobs in two years, with a focus on first-time job seekers. The scheme provides incentives for both employees and employers to boost hiring and economic growth, with a substantial budget allocated for its implementation.

title: Tea, talk, then tragedy: Bandra woman fatally hit by Mumbai bizman's high-end car
content: In Bandra, Kasturbhabai Chavan died after being hit by a car. Jeeva Munecha, the driver, had offered her tea before the accident. Munecha failed to notice Chavan and struck her while starting the car. Police have booked Munecha for negligence and rash driving. Chavan's sons expressed dissatisfaction with the police handling of the case.

title: 'Bengaluru not as planned as Delhi': My children fight with me over traffic, says DKS
content: DCM DK Shivakumar admitted to facing daily complaints from his children regarding Bengaluru's severe traffic congestion and deteriorating road infrastructure. He highlighted the exponential increase in vehicles and population, making road widening impractical due to high property costs.

title: ‘Putin won’t mess with me’: Trump before Alaska meet, claims Russia-Ukraine ‘will make peace’
content: President Trump asserted that Vladimir Putin won't "mess around" with him ahead of their summit in Alaska, where they plan to discuss a potential ceasefire in Ukraine. Trump believes Putin desires full control of Ukraine but insists this won't happen under his presidency. He also proposed a second meeting involving European leaders and Volodymyr Zelenskyy to foster peace negotiations.

title: SIR row: Supreme Court directs EC to publish 65 lakh deleted names with reasons
content: The Supreme Court has directed the Election Commission to enhance transparency in Bihar's electoral roll revision by publishing the names and reasons for deletion of 65 lakh voters. This move aims to counter allegations against the special intensive revision (SIR).

title: 'My country, my identity, my life' – Gambhir’s powerful Independence Day message
content: Gautam Gambhir's Independence Day message reflects his deep patriotism, mirroring his cricketing journey now as India's head coach. His tenure has seen mixed Test results, including a 2-2 draw in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy. However, India has dominated in T20Is and rebounded from an ODI series loss to win the 2025 Champions Trophy, showcasing Gambhir's commitment to accountability and national pride.

title: Patrick Mahomes: Footballer praises Brittany’s bravery; shares childbirth story
content: Patrick Mahomes revealed in ESPN's 'The Kingdom' that his wife, Brittany, gave birth to their third child, Golden Raye, during the 2025 NFL playoffs. Brittany went into labor on January 12, allowing Patrick to witness the birth without missing any playoff games. The docuseries highlights the Mahomes family's life, balancing football, fame, and family.

title: Arjun Tendulkar gets engaged to Saaniya Chandok - Pictures, net worth and everything you need to know
content: Arjun Tendulkar, son of cricket icon Sachin Tendulkar, is engaged to Saaniya Chandok, daughter of a prominent Mumbai business family. The intimate ceremony, attended by close family, marks the union of cricketing legacy and business prominence. Saaniya, involved in her family's Graviss Group and Mr.

title: Independence Day: 5 Shaurya Chakras for war on terror & Naxals
content: On Independence Day eve, several police and security personnel are set to receive honors for their bravery. Three CRPF members will be awarded the Shaurya Chakra for their courage in encounters in J&K, alongside two Chhattisgarh Police officers recognized for anti-Naxal operations.

title: 'Coolie' box office: Rajinikanth's action drama scores opening day collection of Rs 65 cr
content: Rajinikanth's 'Coolie', directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, released on August 14. The film clashed with 'War 2' but dominated the box office. 'Coolie' earned approximately Rs 65 crore in India on its opening day. Overseas collections are estimated at Rs 75 crore. The film's worldwide collection reached around Rs 140 crore.

title: J&K statehood plea: SC seeks Centre’s reply, says 'can’t ignore Pahalgam incident'
content: The Supreme Court has directed the Centre to respond to a petition seeking the restoration of statehood to Jammu & Kashmir. However, the court acknowledged the prevailing ground situation, citing the Pahalgam terror attack. The Centre's assurance of restoring statehood 'at the earliest' was recalled, while the court recognized that assembly elections have been conducted.

title: LeBron James’ wife says their love story could’ve ended without his crucial career move
content: Savannah James, wife of NBA star LeBron James, revealed in a podcast episode that their relationship might not have survived if LeBron hadn't been drafted by the Cleveland Cavaliers. She expressed uncertainty about their future had he not stayed close to home. Despite early challenges, including a teenage pregnancy, the couple persevered and married in 2013.

title: Dwyane Wade's wife shares perimenopause struggle, emotional toll as a Black woman
content: Gabrielle Union openly discussed her experiences with perimenopause, including hair loss, mood changes, and anxiety, impacting her mental health. She highlighted the challenges and feelings of isolation during this phase. With Dwyane Wade's support, the couple navigated these difficulties, and Union is now embracing a happy phase of her life while raising their daughter, Kaavia.

title: Olympic Gold Medalist Chloe Kim shows up at boyfriend Myles Garrett’s Browns practice
content: Despite a recent speeding incident where Myles Garrett was fined, his girlfriend, Chloe Kim, showed unwavering support by attending his practice. The couple's affection was evident as they were visibly captivated by each other during interviews and red-carpet photos. Their relationship, which began three months ago, continues to flourish amidst Garrett's NFL preseason preparations.

title: Jayden's viral moment: Daniels holds teammate's baby; Commanders fans unfazed
content: Washington Commanders' quarterback Jayden Daniels, despite his on-field prowess, hilariously struggled while holding teammate Mike Sainristil’s daughter. While fans playfully teased him, they remain focused on his performance as a quarterback. After leading the team to the NFC Championship Game, expectations are high for Daniels' sophomore year as he aims to elevate the Commanders further.

title: Gallantry awards honour heroes of Op Sindoor; IAF, Army & BSF personnel recognised for valour
content: In recognition of their bravery and strategic contributions during Operation Sindoor, a series of gallantry and distinguished service awards were announced. These awards honored personnel from the IAF, Army, and BSF for their exceptional valor and dedication in executing deep cross-border strikes against terror hubs and military installations.

title: 'They were ready to go nuclear,' says Trump, claims again that he solved India-Pak issue
content: Donald Trump claimed to have brokered peace between India and Pakistan ahead of his Alaska summit with Russian President Vladimir Putin. "Six or seven planes came down. They were ready to go. Maybe nuclear. We solved that," Trump said about the India-Pakistan tension. Air Chief Marshal Staff Amar Preet Singh recently said India shot down five Pakistani fighter jets and one other large aircraft during Operation Sindoor. Pakistan rejected the claim.

title: Bengali migrants illegally held, says West Bengal: Supreme Court seeks response of 8 states
content: The Supreme Court has requested responses from eight states, including UP and Maharashtra, regarding the alleged unauthorized detention of Muslim migrant workers from West Bengal. The West Bengal Migrant Workers Welfare Board claims these detentions are based on mere suspicion of being Bangladeshi nationals.

title: Sandwich assault arrest: DOJ worker fired after allegedly attacking CBP agent in DC - Video
content: A Department of Justice employee, Sean Charles Dunn, was fired after allegedly assaulting a Customs and Border Protection agent with a Subway sandwich in Washington D.C. The incident occurred on Sunday night, where Dunn reportedly shouted at federal officers, calling them "fascists," before throwing the sandwich.

title: Cardi B breaks silence on Taylor Swift’s album announcement near her own release date
content: Amidst releasing new albums and dating NFL stars, Taylor Swift and Cardi B are creating buzz. Cardi B playfully reacted to Swift's album release date, expressing relief it didn't clash with her own. Fans are excited about the prospect of seeing Swift and Cardi B together at NFL games, supporting their partners Travis Kelce and Stefon Diggs.

title: 'Thought he’d just be a hometown hero': LeBron James' wife recalled her early expectations
content: LeBron James and his wife Savannah's enduring love story, which began in their teens, continues to inspire. Savannah revealed she never envisioned LeBron's monumental NBA success, initially seeing him as a local hero. Despite his fame and fortune, LeBron remains devoted to his family, crediting Savannah for his achievements.

title: Diabetes dietitian recommends four foods to lower blood sugar to non-diabetic level
content: Diabetes is a growing concern in the US, affecting millions. Experts Diana Licalzi & Jose Tejero suggest incorporating beans, broccoli, edamame, and berries into your diet. These foods are rich in fiber, protein, and compounds that improve insulin sensitivity and help manage blood sugar levels, potentially aiding in diabetes reversal.

title: Omar attends Independence Day event in Srinagar, first elected CM in eight years to unfurl tricolour in J&K
content: PDP president Mehbooba Mufti was the last Chief Minister to preside over the Independence Day function in Srinagar in 2017

title: Karnataka rain: 878 roads spanning 343 km damaged in Bengaluru this year
content: The data was presented by Deputy Chief Minister D.K. Shivakumar during the ongoing monsoon session of the Karnataka legislature

title: Independence Day 2025: In warning to Pakistan, terrorists and those providing safe haven will be treated alike, says PM Modi
content: The Prime Minister announced that India will launch a mission named 'Sudarshan Chakra' to "expand, strengthen, and modernise" this national security shield

title: Major attack on Independence Day thwarted in Tripura as police arrest 2 with explosives
content: Two suspected members of the Tripura United National Force (TUNF), a newly-formed outfit, were arrested from the vehicle with 14 electric detonators and neogel explosives, SP Avinash Kumar Rai

title: PM Independence Day speech: Modi is standing like a wall against any harmful policy related to farmers, fishermen and cattle rearers
content: The remarks are important as the U.S. is seeking duty concessions from India in agriculture and dairy sectors in the proposed bilateral trade agreement (BTA), being negotiated between the two countries

title: 44-year-old man stabs parents to death in Kerala’s Alappuzha
content: Though the accused left the house after committing the double murder, the police soon nabbed him. Police said the accused committed the murders while under the influence of alcohol

title: NIMHANS to organise workshop on ‘Immediate Care for Psychological Events and Emergencies’ in Bengaluru
content: NIMHANS has designed this workshop specifically for common people, even those without a behavioural science background

title: At the crossroads: on TCS layoffs
content: The recent announcement of TCS that it would be releasing 2% of its global workforce has sent shockwaves across the 20 lakh IT/ITeS workforce in Karnataka. Many feel that what is happening at TCS is an indication of bigger disruptions to come. Shilpa Elizabeth looks at the challenges faced by the employees and the industry, which blames the advent of AI for the downtrend

title: When water scorches the earth
content: Over one lakh coconut trees have died over the past six years in the Central Godavari Delta as saline backwaters from a once-life giving watercourse poisons soil in nine villages. The man-made disaster has crippled lives and paralysed local economies and threatens to tear asunder an age-old bond between people and a vital crop, writes T. Appala Naidu

title: PM Modi I-Day speech: India achieves clean energy target 5 years ahead of schedule, says Modi
content: India has achieved its ambitious climate target of having 50% of its cumulative installed electricity capacity from non-fossil-based sources five years ahead of schedule, says the Prime Minister

title: Bribe and prejudice: when graft charges slip through the cracks in Telangana
content: In Telangana, instances of officers getting caught taking a bribe may spark a scandal, but it is rarely a career-ender. Bureaucratic delays, alleged shoddy investigations and ‘political shielding’ drag cases to a crawl. Many accused officers not only return to their posts but climb the ranks, while prosecutions fade into obscurity. The result? A system that claims to fight graft but too often shields the corrupt. Lavpreet Kaur exposes how anti-corruption cases end without a sense of justice

title: Forest Advisory Committee defers Sharavathi PSP proposal by KPCL, seeks clarifications on tree cutting
content: It referred to the recommendations of the Standing Committee of the National Board of Wildlife in its meeting held in June and asked the status of compliance

title: Former APSRTC Chairman predicts imprisonment for Jagan in liquor scam
content: Accusing Mr. Jagan of fearing the CBI, he questioned why the former Chief Minister met jailed YSRCP leaders in the liquor scam but not the arrested officials

title: PM Modi I-Day speech: India working towards having its own space station, says Modi
content: The Prime Minister said India is working on becoming self-reliant in the space sector as well, and is preparing for launch of Gaganyaan

title: The State of Madras broke into unbounded joy a day before independence in 1947
content: From Mount Road to the lanes of Mylapore, the air was filled with the sound of drums, conchs, and patriotic songs. The Corporation of Madras started making arrangements nearly two weeks before the ceremonial transfer of power. The Mayor appealed to citizens to whitewash their houses and decorate them in the best manner possible

title: How traders welcomed Free India
content: On the morning of August 15, merchants and chambers of commerce joined the celebrations. Traders placed interesting advertisements on the pages of The Hindu, which were brimming with tributes, patriotic appeal, and writings of leaders

title: How Tamil cinema plunged into freedom movement after the advent of talkies
content: Theatre personalities entered the film world, carrying their ardent support for the cause of Indian independence. Though censorship remained a challenge for them, the Government of India Act, 1935, and the election of C. Rajagopalachari as the Prime Minister of the Madras Presidency in 1937 helped them in their endeavour

title: Medical graduates in Kerala flag delay in getting registration from KSMC
content: Medical council president says despatch of applications in bulk, defects in documents causing the delay

title: PM Modi I-Day speech: Made-in-India semiconductor chip to come in market by this year end, says Modi
content: Addressing the nation on the 79th Independence Day, PM Modi said that six semiconductor units are already on the ground and four new units have been given green signal

title: U.S. has no alternative to India in diamonds, say industry leaders
content: Industry estimates show that the U.S. alone accounts for more than 30% of India’s gem and jewellery exports, making it the single-largest overseas buyer

title: CPI(M) urges people to ‘Reclaim the Night’ again, a year since R.G. Kar rape and murder
content: Last year, thousands of people across the State took to the streets on eve of Independence Day to protest the heinous rape and murder of a female on-duty doctor at R.G. Kar Medical College and Hospital that had occurred a few days ago

title: There would have been no independence without Bengal says W.B. CM
content: Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said that the Union government was free to act against foreigners but spoke against unnecessary targeting of people for speaking in Bengali

title: Odisha’s oldest engineering institute introduce uniform code for students
content: Dupattas have been banned for girls on ‘safety’ grounds, as the long scarves could get caught in moving machinery in laboratories

title: CM Nitish Kumar conducts aerial survey of flood affected areas in Bihar
content: The Chief Minister asked the Water Resources Department to be fully alert and keep monitoring the water level in the low lying areas continuously

title: Punjab Cabinet withdraws land pooling policy 2025; farmers term it as people’s movement victory
content: The AAP government notified the Land Pooling Policy on June 4, which invited sharp criticism and resistance from farmers and farm labourer outfits, landholders, and political parties

title: Kishtwar cloudburst: J-K authorities identify 21 bodies
content: The death toll has risen to 46, including two CISF personnel; 167 people have been rescued in injured condition, while 69 are reported missing

title: Independence Day LIVE: Want to promote sports in far flung areas, NSP 2025 will help spread it, says PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Modi announced the launch of a ₹1 lakh crore scheme for the youth - the PM Viksit Bharat Rozgar Yojana. Under this scheme, those getting their first job in the private sector will get ₹15,000 from the government.

title: YSRCP alleges large-scale irregularities in Pulivendula, Ontimitta ZPTC bypolls
content: Non-local TDP workers have been allowed to cast bogus votes and the police have acted as a shield, it alleges

title: Conserving water resources will boost groundwater level, says Naidu
content: Stating that effective management has helped store up to 82% capacity of reservoirs and barrages this season, the Chief Minister calls for restructuring of irrigation engineering systems

title: National flag on 40 lakh houses as part of BJP’s campaign
content: BJP encourages hoisting tricolour on 40 lakh houses for Independence Day, promoting patriotism and national unity.

title: Two police officers selected for President’s Medal
content: Three officers of the Correctional Services have also been selected for the Meritorious Service Awards.

title: Screening for cab and auto drivers proposed
content: Medical Education Minister Sharan Prakash Patil said a committee headed by Jayadeva Institute of Cardiovascular Sciences and Research director Ravindranath was formed to look into the deaths owing to heart attacks in Hassan.

title: 78 Years of Freedom: A collection of stories commemorating the progress of nation
content: Writing for The Hindu on Independence Day, the Chief Ministers of Tamil Nadu, Karnataka and Kerala note that India’s hallmark is its democratic legacy

title: CPI(M) leaders’ tour of Polavaram-hit areas begins tomorrow
content: John Brittas will arrive in Vijayawada in the afternoon and meet residents in Jeelugumilli and Buttayigudem mandals of Eluru district.

title: Palavagu breach causes inundation at iconic Secretariat Complex in Amaravati
content: Water enters two of the five blocks of the under-construction complex, but work is progressing at the remaining structures

title: The Sisyphean quest to bolster manufacturing in India
content: The sector remains an also-ran in India’s growth story, despite fervent attempts by government after government. The services sector, on the other hand, has blossomed outside the government’s focus

title: Islands of excellence amid a morass of stuttering institutions
content: Planners, right from Independence, just did not pay attention to the quality of education delivered by primary schools even as they were setting up the high-performing higher education institutions. And that told on the literacy and math skills of the average Indian

title: Why are thousands of small and marginal farmers in Maharashtra rejoicing about India-U.K. FTA?
content: How collective farming is helping thousands of small and marginal farmers in the grape capital of India to reap benefits of international markets

title: The last stand before the divide: Remembering the INA Trials and the Idea of India
content: The Red Fort Trials of 1945-46 were not just about three soldiers of the Indian National Army. They were the crucible in which a shared dream of a fair, secular, and united India was tested, forged, and almost triumphed

title: Tracks to Freedom: how railways kick-started the journey towards nationhood
content: New-found mobility opened Indians up to recognise, accept, and respect mutual differences in a diverse country, and they also experienced commonness and oneness

title: Broccoli botulism outbreak: Woman describes how she survived from deadly snack that killed 2 others
content: A botulism outbreak traced to a food truck in southern Italy has resulted in two deaths and multiple hospitalizations. The contaminated sandwiches, containing sausage and turnip tops, were linked to the illness.

title: Champion bodybuilder Hayley McNeff dies at 37, Massachusetts community mourns sudden loss
content: Champion bodybuilder Hayley McNeff, originally from Concord, Massachusetts, passed away unexpectedly on August 8, 2025. Known for her vibrant personality and achievements in equestrian, diving, and skiing, she later excelled in bodybuilding, securing state titles and appearing in a documentary. After retiring from competition, McNeff pursued graduate studies in psychology.

title: India and U.S. to hold joint military exercise in Alaska this month, says MEA
content: Recently, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh postponed his visit to the United States, which was originally scheduled for the last week of August.

title: Kannur declared extreme-poverty free district
content: Around 15,000 people earlier excluded from the Life Mission housing scheme have been added to the beneficiary list, with construction under way

title: Congress, CPI(M) trade charges over draft voters’ list in Kozhikode
content: DCC president says a preliminary study by the party has found over one lakh “double votes” and fake voter identity cards in Kozhikode; CPI(M) alleges efforts by IUML to add fake voters

title: Keep alive ideals for which countless lives were given
content: Independence Day must inspire in us not complacency, but commitment and a resolve to confront inequality, to heal divisions, and to build an India where prosperity is shared, the environment is cherished, and every voice is heard

title: Many languages, one India
content: The country has a long and healthy tradition of multilingualism, and any attempt to force monolingualism, overtly or covertly, will not find takers

title: Toddler killed; five others injured in road accident near Arakkonam
content: The family lives in Vanniyampettai village near Arakkonam town, where they cultivate their three-acre farmland.

title: Struggling to make it to the big league in sports
content: The National Sports Federations reek of bad governance; inadequate coaching, limited sports infrastructure and funding, and non-uniform access to cutting-edge sports science and nutrition contribute to the poor performances

title: Vital gains in the health of citizens
content: The country has learnt that ensuring health for all, consistent delivery of a standard of care to all segments of the population, irrespective of their ability to pay, is the only steady way ahead

title: Union Minister assures Karnataka of making arrangements for supply of fertilizers to tide over shortage
content: Union Minister for Agriculture Shivaraj Singh Chauhan has assured Karnataka, facing urea shortage, of making arrangements to supply the remaining quantum of fertilizers from the allocated share to help tide over the shortage, according to Karnataka Agriculture Minister N. Cheluvarayaswamy

title: ITeS not so simple any more
content: From being a sure-fire path to upward financial and social mobility, tech graduates are finding that the information technology-enabled services industry may no longer be able to offer them what it could even just a couple of years ago, finds Aroon Deep

title: Honour India’s legacy, defend its democracy
content: Independence Day this year is a stark reminder of the state India is in; it is a reminder of how Indians should resist any moves to undermine the country’s constitutional principles

title: Science and nation-building
content: India has made great leaps in science and technology. The founding fathers have envisioned a nation that thinks rationally with scientific temper. Are we a people guided by this spirit in this era of technology?

title: Federal balance is a key indicator of a thriving democracy
content: India is home to many nationalities, and to ensure harmony among them, the States were reorganised along linguistic lines; linguistic diversity is a defining feature of India

title: Mahatma Gandhi made a mistake by making Nehru the PM, says Uddhav Thackeray
content: Mr. Thackeray was speaking  at the State-wide agitation of opposition parties and civil rights groups against the Maharashtra Special Public Security Bill.

title: Prime Minister to flag off key metro links in Kolkata on August 22
content: Much-awaited metro connections, including the airport link, and the pending connection in the east-west under-river corridor, will be inaugurated

title: Defence personnel awarded gallantry medals for success of Operation Sindoor
content: The Central Reserve Police Force received 23 Gallantry Medals, the highest among the Central Armed Police Forces, including three Shaurya Chakras and 20 Gallantry Medals for valour in J&K, and in anti-Maoist operations

title: Rahul Gandhi accused of making false statements in Savarkar defamation proceedings
content: The plea alleges the Congress MP falsely denied receiving key video evidence, despite multiple acknowledgements and court demonstrations; next hearing on September 10

title: School Education Minister responds to queries on TNSEP
content: Mr. Poyyamozhi clarified that Samacheer Kalvi textbooks would continue to be the base material for schools along with a mandate to update them every three years.

title: EC issues notice to Vaishali MP, her JD(U) MLC husband for possessing two voter ID cards
content: The notice comes a day after Bihar Leader of the Opposition Tejashwi Yadav had pointed out that the two leaders had dual EPIC numbers

title: India endorses Trump-Putin summit in Alaska
content: The summit could also decide the course of the imposed U.S. tariffs on India as Trump had previously accused New Delhi of fuelling the Russian ‘war machine’ with its energy purchases

title: Operation Sindoor an example of humanity’s fight against terrorism: President Murmu
content: On the eve of Independence Day, President Droupadi Murmu lauds India’s unity after Pahalgam terror attack and says “world has taken note of our stance”; in her speech she pays rich tributes to India’s ancient democratic traditions

title: Citing The Hindu’s report, Rahul Gandhi says BJP is stealing rights of tribals by ‘erasing papers’
content: After a report by The Hindu on forest rights titles found missing in Chhattisgarh government records, Congress leader says his party enacted the Forest Rights Act to protect the water, forest, and land of tribals but the BJP was ‘weakening’ the legislation

title: Rajnath hails Operation Sindoor as model of precision, self-reliance on eve of Independence Day
content: It was a clear message from India that we are tolerant, but when it comes to the safety of our people and the dignity of our country, we unite and face every challenge boldly, says the Defence Minister

title: Bar Council of India imposes three-year moratorium on new law colleges nationwide
content: The step is aimed at preventing ‘the commercialisation of legal education, widespread academic malpractice, and persistent shortages of qualified faculty’, says BCI

title: BJP terms SC order on use of Aadhaar in Bihar SIR clarificatory, not a substantive comment on exercise
content: BJP president and Union Minister J.P. Nadda says Congress ‘clutching at non-issues and parading them as moral victories’

content: On Wednesday, Mr. Thakur had listed constituencies, including Rae Bareli, Kannauj, Wayanad, and Diamond Harbour, where fake voters were allegedly present in large numbers
